events.name: Creation of a Diverse Domestic Battery Supply Chain
events.description: Emphasizes the goal of creating a diverse, domestic battery supply chain within five years.

events.wd_description: Strategic planning focuses on addressing risks and capitalizing on opportunities identified in the report to enhance the battery supply chain.

events.name: Critical materials supply
events.wd_description: The supply of critical materials like cobalt and nickel is crucial for the production of LIBs, with concerns over their availability and costs due to limited reserves concentrated in a few countries.

events.name: Pressure on Critical Materials Supply
events.description: The increased demand for batteries poses pressure on the supply of critical materials such as cobalt and nickel, with their reserves and production concentrated in a few countries like the Republic of Congo and China.

events.name: LIB supply chain
events.wd_description: The LIB supply chain is segmented into three key sectors: portable microelectronics and tools, powertrains for transportation, and utility-grid energy storage.

events.name: Portable microelectronics and tools
events.wd_description: This sector involves the use of LIBs in various small-scale electronic devices and tools.
events.description: This sector involves the use of LIBs in various small-scale electronic devices and tools.

events.name: Powertrains for transportation
events.wd_description: This sector focuses on the use of LIBs in electric vehicles and other transportation powertrains.

events.name: Utility-grid energy storage
events.wd_description: This sector involves the use of LIBs for storing energy in utility grids to balance supply and demand.

events.name: Increase in Global LIB Market Value
events.description: In 2020, it is estimated that the global LIB market will reach a 35-billion-dollar mark, with billions of cells used in three key sectors: portable microelectronics and tools, powertrains for transportation, and utility-grid energy storage.

events.name: Rapid Growth Anticipation for EV and Battery Energy Storage Systems
events.description: The market for electric vehicles and battery energy storage systems could double by 2025, increasing the demand for batteries.

events.wd_description: LIBS were first commercialized by Sony in 1991.

events.name: Resource challenges
events.wd_description: The increased demand for LIBs will put pressure on the reserves of lithium, cobalt, nickel, and manganese, leading to potential resource challenges.

events.name: Lithium reserves
events.wd_description: Lithium does not occur naturally and is primarily recovered from salt solutions like brines.
events.description: Lithium does not occur naturally and is primarily recovered from salt solutions like brines.

events.name: Cobalt reserves
events.wd_description: Cobalt is mined primarily as a by-product of nickel and copper, with significant reserves in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
events.description: Cobalt is mined primarily as a by-product of nickel and copper, with significant reserves in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

events.name: Nickel reserves
events.wd_description: Nickel reserves are highly concentrated in Indonesia, the Philippines, Russia, and New Caledonia.
events.description: Nickel reserves are highly concentrated in Indonesia, the Philippines, Russia, and New Caledonia.

events.name: Manganese reserves
events.wd_description: Manganese reserves are essential for LIB production, with demand expected to increase significantly.

events.name: Evolution of cathode chemistries
events.wd_description: Initial LIB cells used lithium cobalt oxide (LCO) cathodes, which have been replaced by lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxide (NMC) and lithium nickel cobalt aluminum oxide (NCA) cathodes due to better performance and lower cost.
events.description: Initial LIB cells used lithium cobalt oxide (LCO) cathodes, which have been replaced by lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxide (NMC) and lithium nickel cobalt aluminum oxide (NCA) cathodes due to better performance and lower cost.

events.name: LCO cathode
events.wd_description: The initial LIB cell was based on a lithium cobalt oxide (LCO) cathode, which had low energy density, inferior safety, short lifespan, and high cost.
events.description: The initial LIB cell was based on a lithium cobalt oxide (LCO) cathode, which had low energy density, inferior safety, short lifespan, and high cost.

events.name: NMC cathode
events.wd_description: Lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxide (NMC) cathodes offer high energy density, extended lifespan, and lower cost compared to LCO.
events.description: Lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxide (NMC) cathodes offer high energy density, extended lifespan, and lower cost compared to LCO.

events.name: NCA cathode
events.wd_description: Lithium nickel cobalt aluminum oxide (NCA) cathodes provide high energy density and are used in various electric vehicles.
events.description: Lithium nickel cobalt aluminum oxide (NCA) cathodes provide high energy density and are used in various electric vehicles.

events.name: Evolution from LCO to NMC and NCA cathodes
events.description: The initial LCO cathode was replaced by NMC and NCA cathodes, which offer higher energy density, extended life span, and lower cost.

events.name: Shift towards high Ni low Co NMC cathodes
events.description: The market trend for NMC cathodes is moving from low Ni to high Ni/low Co, with NMC 811 becoming more prevalent.

events.name: Future dominance of LFP cathodes
events.description: LFP cathodes are expected to dominate the future LIB market, especially in China, due to their safety and specific energy advantages.
